dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Another day, another dip for the dollar against the tenge. I'm just not convinced this is anything more than short-term fluctuation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Another day, another dip for the dollar against the tenge. I'm just not convinced this is anything more than short-term fluctuation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The US dollar has continued to weaken against the tenge in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But look at the numbers—it fell by 0.22 percent, settling at 510.19 tenge per dollar. That's a concrete move, not just noise.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But look at the numbers-it fell by zero point two two percent, settling at five hundred ten point one nine tenge per dollar. That's a concrete move, not just noise.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the latest data from the Kazakhstan Stock Exchange (KASE), the dollar fell by 0.22 percent, settling at 510.19 tenge per dollar.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but these tiny percentage shifts—0.22, 0.09—they barely register in real-world terms for most people.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but these tiny percentage shiftsminus zero point two two, zero point zero nine-they barely register in real-world terms for most people.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This follows a slight decrease recorded on June 4, when the dollar fell by 0.09 percent against the tenge.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Actually, when you see it across buying and selling rates too, like 510.37 to buy and 512.28 to sell in Almaty, it starts painting a clearer trend.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Actually, when you see it across buying and selling rates too, like five hundred ten point three seven to buy and five hundred twelve point two eight to sell in Almaty, it starts painting a clearer trend.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to kurs.kz, the average exchange rate in Almaty currency exchange offices currently stands at 510.37 tenge for buying and 512.28 for selling.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Almaty's one thing, but what about Astana? The spread there is even wider—buying at 508.59, selling at 514.59. That inconsistency makes me skeptical.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Almaty's one thing, but what about Astana? The spread there is even wider-buying at five hundred eight point five nine, selling at five hundred fourteen point five nine. That inconsistency makes me skeptical.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In Astana, the dollar is being bought at an average of 508.59 tenge and sold at 514.59.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the National Bank's official rate was set at 511.67 tenge per dollar for June 5, which kind of anchors things, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the National Bank's official rate was set at five hundred eleven point six seven tenge per dollar for June five, which kind of anchors things, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The National Bank of Kazakhstan set the official exchange rate for June 5 at 511.67 tenge per dollar.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Maybe, but central banks tweak rates all the time. It doesn't necessarily signal a lasting trend.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Maybe, but central banks tweak rates all the time. It doesn't necessarily signal a lasting trend.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But then you've got the National Bank governor already sharing the 2025 base rate forecast—that suggests they're planning for continued tenge strength, or at least stability.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then you've got the National Bank governor already sharing the twenty twenty five base rate forecast-that suggests they're planning for continued tenge strength, or at least stability.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: National Bank governor shares 2025 base rate forecast

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Or it could just be optimistic forward guidance. I mean, forecasts are just that—forecasts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Or it could just be optimistic forward guidance. I mean, forecasts are just that-forecasts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: True, but when you combine it with back-to-back daily declines, it feels like there might be some momentum here.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, but when you combine it with back-to-back daily declines, it feels like there might be some momentum here.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The US dollar has continued to weaken against the tenge in Kazakhstan. This follows a slight decrease recorded on June 4, when the dollar fell by 0.09 percent against the tenge.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: I'll give you that the consistency is interesting—two days in a row of drops isn't nothing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I'll give you that the consistency is interesting-two days in a row of drops isn't nothing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And with exchange offices and the stock exchange both reflecting similar moves, it's not isolated.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And with exchange offices and the stock exchange both reflecting similar moves, it's not isolated.

dialogue_turns.text: Okay, maybe there's a bit more to it. I still want to see if this holds through the week though.
